creditline: Gift of David Tausig Frank and Kazukuni Sugiyama
description: paper carton is wrapped in brown paper; wooden box with inscriptions inside; fabric is light green/grey; image of tree branches in black ink with inscription in LL corner
inscription:
? {?} (Plum blossoms mirror the white clouds of daybreak / The bright moon hangs silent in the spring sky / All corners of the world are filled with its light / Fragrance flows into the darkest places / The mountain greenery stands reflected in the clear waters / All I can do is to gaze.)
? {?} (The moon knows:/ this fragrance is flower-borne a truth passed down from ancient times. Such a mystery / difficult to explain in words.) 
? {?} (I have brushed these poems apart, yet they are more beautiful to me than even the lovely pond beside my house.)
markings: URC red seal: [unread #5]; poem UR red seal: 〇〇 [unread #2]; LL red seals: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō} [Fukuda Seikō #1], 静處 {seisho} [seisho #1]; LLC: [unread #8], [unread #9]
title: Old Plum
